Description: Sherd from base of Aeolian grey ware pottery open-work stand; exterior: dark slip; curving plastic ornament attached to moulding on top of foot-ring.
Curator's comments: Almost certainly from the same stand as British Museum 1888,0601.638 (and probably 637). If so, we have a tail associated with the paw (of a panther) on 638.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.106)
